title: Team Fortress 2 Comprehensive Quiz
description: A 30-question quiz testing your knowledge of Team Fortress 2 game mechanics and lore from the official comics.

questions.question: Which class in Team Fortress 2 is known for building sentry guns?
questions.explanation: The Engineer is the class responsible for building sentry guns, dispensers, and teleporters. These buildings provide defensive, supportive, and mobility advantages to the team.

questions.question: What is the name of the Engineer's default primary weapon?
questions.explanation: The Engineer's default primary weapon is the Shotgun. It's a versatile weapon that allows the Engineer to defend himself and his buildings at close to mid range.

questions.question: Which comic prominently features both Miss Pauling and the Administrator working together?
questions.explanation: Miss Pauling and the Administrator appear throughout the TF2 comics. 'Ring of Fire' features both characters heavily, though they were introduced earlier in the game's lore and promotional material.

questions.question: What is the name of the Heavy's minigun?
questions.explanation: The Heavy's default minigun is named Sasha. This is revealed in the game's official lore and comics, where the Heavy is shown to have a strong attachment to his weapon.

questions.question: Which class has the highest default health in the game?
questions.explanation: The Heavy has the highest default health in the game at 300 HP. This makes him the tank of the team, able to absorb more damage than any other class.

questions.question: Which class is known for its speed and agility?
questions.explanation: The Scout is known for his speed and agility, allowing him to quickly capture objectives and evade enemy fire.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a default weapon for the Scout?
questions.explanation: The Force-A-Nature is an unlockable weapon for the Scout, not his default weapon. The Scout's default loadout consists of the Scattergun, Pistol, and Bat.

questions.question: What is the name of the Demoman's default primary weapon?
questions.explanation: The Demoman's default grenade launcher is simply called the Grenade Launcher. It fires live grenades that explode after a short delay or upon impact with surfaces.

questions.question: In the TF2 lore, what is the relationship between the Demoman and the Soldier?
options: They are rivals from the same town
questions.explanation: In the TF2 lore, the Demoman and the Soldier are portrayed as drinking buddies and occasional allies, not relatives or business partners.

questions.question: What is the primary role of the Medic class?
questions.explanation: The primary role of the Medic is healing teammates. The Medic uses his Medigun to heal injured teammates and can also provide ÜberCharge, which grants temporary invulnerability to himself and his healing target.

questions.question: What is the name of the Medic's default healing tool?
questions.explanation: The Medic's default healing tool is called the Medigun. It heals teammates and builds ÜberCharge, which can then be activated to grant temporary invulnerability.

questions.question: What is the relationship between Scout and Spy?
questions.explanation: The comic 'The Naked and the Dead' reveals that the Spy is the father of the Scout, though this is presented in a humorous, exaggerated way typical of TF2’s lore.

questions.question: What is the Sniper's default primary weapon called?
questions.explanation: The Sniper's default primary weapon is called the Sniper Rifle. It's a high-powered rifle that can deal massive damage with a fully charged headshot.

questions.question: Which class can double jump in TF2?
questions.explanation: The Scout is the only class in TF2 that can naturally double jump. Soldier and Demoman can rocket or sticky jump, but these are not true double jumps.

questions.question: What is the name of the map where the RED and BLU teams fight over a briefcase in the 2Fort map style?
questions.explanation: The map where RED and BLU teams fight over a briefcase in the classic 2Fort style is called 2Fort. It's one of the most iconic maps in TF2, featuring two symmetrical forts connected by bridges.

questions.question: Which TF2 comic shows the origins of the RED and BLU teams?
questions.explanation: The origins of RED and BLU are revealed in 'A Cold Day in Hell' and in supplemental lore about Zepheniah Mann, who divided the land between his sons, REDmond and BLUtar.

questions.question: What is the name of the Heavy's family in the TF2 lore?
options: The Heavy's family is never named
questions.explanation: In the TF2 lore, the Heavy’s family name is Mikhail. He lives with his mother and sisters in Siberia, as shown in the comics.

questions.question: Which classes in TF2 have lethal taunt kills?
questions.explanation: Almost every class in TF2 has at least one taunt kill, including Spy, Heavy, Demoman, Soldier, Pyro, Sniper, and others.

questions.question: What is the name of the map that features a train carrying the payload?
questions.explanation: The map that features a train carrying the payload is called Badwater Basin. In this map, the BLU team must push a bomb-laden cart to the RED team's base.

questions.question: Which TF2 comic reveals the backstory of the Engineer?
options: None - his story is told in bios and supplemental lore
questions.explanation: The Engineer does not have a dedicated comic for his backstory. His history is revealed through class bios and supplemental lore.

questions.question: What is the name of the Pyro's default flamethrower?
questions.explanation: The Pyro's default flamethrower is simply called the Flamethrower. It shoots a continuous stream of fire that can ignite enemies and deal damage over time.

questions.question: In the TF2 lore, what is the relationship between the Pyro and the Heavy?
options: The Pyro is the Heavy's cousin
The Pyro is the Heavy's childhood friend
Their relationship is not specified in the lore
questions.explanation: The relationship between the Pyro and the Heavy is not specified in the official TF2 lore. While they sometimes fight alongside each other, no backstory links them.

questions.question: What is the name of the game mode where players capture control points in a specific order?
questions.explanation: The game mode where players capture control points in a specific order is called Control Points. In this mode, teams must capture a series of control points to progress and ultimately win the match.

questions.question: Which class can turn invisible in TF2?
questions.explanation: The Spy is the only class in TF2 that can turn invisible. Using his cloaking devices (like the Invisibility Watch), the Spy can become nearly undetectable to enemies, making him excellent for reconnaissance and surprise attacks.

questions.question: What is the name of the comic that first introduced Saxton Hale?
questions.explanation: Saxton Hale was first introduced in the 'Mann Co. Store Update' comic, 'Saxton Hale’s Mail Storm,' which showcased his over-the-top personality and role as Mann Co.’s CEO.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a default weapon for any class in TF2?
questions.explanation: The Direct Hit is not a default weapon for any class in TF2. It is an unlockable weapon for the Soldier. The Scattergun, Shotgun, and Pistol are all default weapons for the Scout, Engineer/Soldier/Pyro, and multiple classes respectively.

questions.question: In the TF2 lore, what is the Administrator's first name?
options: Her first name is never revealed
questions.explanation: The Administrator’s first name is Helen, revealed in the comic 'Blood Brothers.'

questions.question: What is the name of the game mode where one team attacks while the other defends control points?
questions.explanation: The game mode where one team attacks while the other defends control points is called Attack/Defend. In this mode, the attacking team must capture a series of control points, while the defending team tries to prevent them from doing so.

questions.question: Which class can build a teleporter in TF2?
questions.explanation: The Engineer is the only class in TF2 that can build a teleporter. The teleporter allows teammates to quickly move between the team's spawn point and forward positions on the map.

questions.question: Which comic reveals details about the Sniper's family and backstory?
questions.explanation: The comic 'Blood Brothers' reveals details about the Sniper’s family and backstory, showing that he was adopted from New Zealand and raised in Australia.
